title: Adnan Syed Murder Charges Dropped by Baltimore Prosecutors; His conviction for the murder of Hae Min Lee, featured on the hit podcast 'Serial,' was vacated in September
text:
Erica Suter, a lawyer for Mr. Syed, said DNA testing excluded Mr. Syed from evidence recovered in the case.

"The DNA results confirmed what we have already known and what underlies all of the current proceedings: that Adnan is innocent and lost 23 years of his life serving time for a crime he did not commit," Ms. Suter said in a statement.

Prosecutors planned to hold a press conference on the matter Tuesday afternoon.

Mr. Syed was convicted in 2000 for the murder of Ms. Lee, an 18-year-old high-school student and his ex-girlfriend. Mr. Syed, who was 17 years old at the time of her death, was charged as an adult. He had been serving a life sentence at the Patuxent Institution, a state prison in Jessup, Md., according to state records.

A Baltimore Circuit judge vacated Mr. Syed's murder conviction in September after prosecutors said new evidence suggested there were two suspects who may have been involved in Ms. Lee's death, including one who had told someone he would make her disappear. The suspects weren't properly ruled out during the first investigation, prosecutors said.

SHARE YOUR THOUGHTS

Did you listen to "Serial" and follow this case? Join the conversation below.

Judge Melissa Phinn ordered Mr. Syed to be released under home detention and said the state would have 30 days to set a new trial date, should they choose to.

Prosecutors said at the time they weren't making the case that he was innocent but said he should have a new trial.

After Mr. Syed's conviction was vacated, "Serial" rose to the top of Apple Inc.'s list of podcasts in the U.S. The podcast released a new episode titled "Adnan Is Out," eight years after the show made its debut.

Write to Joseph De Avila at joseph.deavila@wsj.com

Adnan Syed Murder Charges Dropped by Baltimore Prosecutors
